Reviews.Title: “Old, but reasonable.”
Reviews.Author: Celaya97
Reviews.Content: We got what we paid for. Basic room with a bathroom. We stayed during New Years Eve and it was not bad (a bit noisey, but we were able to sleep well). The building is old, but for the price, you can't expect the hotel to look and feel like the Hilton. If all you want is a room to sleep, shower and close to downtown LA ($14.00 taxi cab ride), then this may be for you.

Reviews.Title: “Good downtown option”
Reviews.Author: Calebmondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 4 nights so that we could attend some events at the Staples centre and surrounding places. We were a bit cautious due to the cheap prices and lack of photos but we very pleasantly surprised. Very short walk to everything, Staples centre, Ralphs supermarket, Denny's etc. Room size was good and there is paid parking next door if you need it. Staff were helpful too.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth it!”
Reviews.Author: fritzVenice_Ca
Reviews.Content: I object to it being called a flophouse. Ok, there are long term guests. And, ok, the guests were not all that well bathed. But to be in Downtown LA, 6 blocks from the Staples Center, and the LA Convention Center, and with a price just a fraction of the Ritz-Carlton, I enjoyed having a place. The room was very clean. I would suggest this hotel to anyone who asked.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is fne”
Reviews.Author: sarpesdon
Reviews.Content: Contrary to the previous reviwer, this hotel is neither filthy nor dangerous. It is no-frills but that is reflected in the price. It is very clean although slightly dilapidated.This area of Downtown is perfectly safe. Frankly, I think the previous reviewer is either insane or workiing for a rival operator.

Reviews.Title: “Good deal, it worked for me”
Reviews.Author: jwolfgang9
Reviews.Content: The room was presentable, the TV/AC/lights were all fine, water temp and pressure was great. The neighborhood is so-so at night. For the price, it was a great deal, and saved me $$$$ over other name-brand hotels in the area. Front desk service is a bit blah. PS: a co-worker staying at the Wilshire at the same time found a large bug in his $190/night room!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: centerisl
Reviews.Content: I agree with the other positive reviews - it's a great value. It's a 10-15 minute walk to the Convention Center, the hotel is clean, the staff is courteous, the wi-fi is fast. I really don't know what those hateful reviews are all about, except perhaps they are exposing some insecurities about a different culture (the entire staff of the hotel appears to be Indian). For that matter, Gill's - the Indian restaurant in the hotel - is quite good - I even brought my boss (who's staying at an "official" convention hotel out by the airport!) and a couple of co-workers there for dinner, and they were all impresssed with the food.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service at Great Price”
Reviews.Author: MisterWombat
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located a few blocks from the Staples Center and convention center with many restaurants nearby and a big Ralph's supermarket 2 blocks away. Hotel is old but staff are obviously making an effort to maintain it with fresh paint and constant cleaning. Staff was ultra-helpful, let us check in at 7 AM when another hotel we'd booked online was unusable, did our airline boarding passes on their front desk computer, etc. Room was not too big but comfortable amount of space, big closet, good sized refrigerator, fastest free high speed wireless I've seen, plenty of hot water, good window air conditioner (a bit noisy). Beds were clean and very comfortable although linen was well worn. Price $40 a night less than cheapest nearby hotels. Recommended hotel to several friends who were paying more for less nearby.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: IrezumiMuzan
Reviews.Content: I just completed an 11 night stay at the Stillwell with my best friend. The room was clean which was the most important thing for me. We had 2 double beds plus TV with cable, a fridge, a desk, and night stand. The shower was super powerful and there was enough closet space for the two of us. Brand new secure locks on all the doors and the transients clear out early in the day. I still adore the location and price. There were slight little things like the last time I stayed there was almost like a mosquito screen across the window. There wasn't this time and something bit me after we left the window open. However, without the screen we were able to hang out of our 10th floor window for some great photos. If you looked closely, there was a stain on the wall and the chair looked like a puppy had teethed on the legs. Nothing major, though; just little cosmetic things. Oh, and there was the weird guys who would sit in reception all day and then stare at us as we walked by. Classy. There's only one thing stopping this from being a five star review. On day 9, my friend confessed she had been killing roaches in the bathroom for about 3 days. I was fully aware there would be roaches and I'm actually fine with this. We went down to the front desk to get some bug spray so I could defend myself but when we told the guy on the front desk, his response was "what do you want me to do about it?" I would have liked it if he had at least feigned surprise at the roach infestation but of course he was fully aware of the problem and a bad actor... His friend then came over to the front desk and started going on about "this is why Brits shouldn't be allowed off the island". They both told me that roaches were clean and I should be happy they were there (ugh). The front desk guy then had the nerve to ask my friend for a cigarette! I was so angry. He said he would go and have a look for some Windex after his cigarette and give me a call. I'm still waiting... His attitude was awful. He did actually apologise to my friend on our last night at the hotel and said he had to look big in front of his "homies" (I actually don't know what that means but I don't think it justifies such disrespectful behaviour). Again, for the price, I wont argue. At least not too much anyway.

Reviews.Title: “You'll have good stories walking away from this place 8-)”
Reviews.Author: secretsmile
Reviews.Content: We picked the hotel because it was cheap for the area, free parking and you could walk from the Orpheum. It's probably a good thing I was not sober checking in after the first nights show. Check in was easy, elevator dirty, got too our room and no air on. Turned on the wall unit and it did cool down. Our room faced the side parking lot (10th floor) so it wasn't noisy. I have been in dirtier places....this place is old. So beds old, linens old. towels old, bathrooms old. For the most part as old and worn as it was I think it was about as clean as it could get. Housekeeping was helpful and did their best. Bartender was not nice (on multiple nights) and I wouldn't spend a dime no matter how cheap it was in there. I did attach a picture(s) of "something" that was "drawn" on the wall bewtween the 2 beds when we arrived. Yes shocked at first - now it's just a good story to tell friends when they ask how my weekend in LA was. Area was pretty safe, very dirty, lots of rats. I counted 12 walking from the Stillwell to the Shell and back. If you stay here you will come out with a great story. If your partying down town this will do it, bed, shower, fridg., ice, and AC. I have to say a plus was late check out was 8pm I think - for $40. All staff was very nice, helpful minus the bar maid. Cheers!

Reviews.Title: “eeh”
Reviews.Author: 69caddy
Reviews.Content: Its not a place for someone who is a clean freak. my cousin and I stayed there last night and we didnt bring any bugs back with us(we did bring our own sheets though) . new locks on the doors and it looked like new carpet in our room. the towels were kinda jacked up so we got new ones. with hit the bar later on and that is a pretty good place except for some of the bar flies. barely any bums. the bad part about the whole thing is when we left in the morning we came to find someone had urinated in the elevator so we took the stairs. there is a plus to it...you can walk anywhere and there is stuff to do and i felt pretty safe even though were young girls in the middle of downtown. it is what it is

Reviews.Title: “where nightmares are made”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Its been almost a year and I still have nightmares about this place. It was dirty. even the front lobby was disgustingly dirty. We stayed on the tenth floor. I thought the elevator was going to fall the whole ride up. It was a small, crowded, rickety junk bucket elevator. Then we get to the room - the locks hardly work. There was two twin beds and the entire place was very old and looked absolutely filthy (matted dirty carpeting, scuffed walls, dusty curtains). Neither my boyfriend nor I felt comfortable walking around barefoot, not even on the beds. we slept on top of the sheets, on the bed furthest from the door. The bathroom was disgusting as well - it had that scary haunted look, the toilet did NOT flush, the showerhead did NOT work (unless you call droplets of water slowly dripping out working) and on top of that the shower drain was clogged. And the worst part - we locked ourselves out of the room on our way out for the night, so when we returned we asked the front desk for a set of spare keys to the room. Which they gave to us. without checking our IDs. or verifying that we lived in that room. So in essence, anyone can walk up to the front desk and get a key to any room and break in. yeah, really safe. In the future i'd rather pay more for safety and cleanliness. A motel six or other motel equivalents would have seemed like a palace in heaven compared to this place.

Reviews.Title: “acceptable and affordable”
Reviews.Author: Elinger
Reviews.Content: Do not expect luxury, but this hotel is perfectly acceptable and convenient. Modest rooms with older furniture and baths, but they are kept clean. You can’t beat this for downtown LA on a budget. There are 2 restaurants in the hotel and a convenient coffee shop on the same block just north of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Old But Okay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Really not too bad but far from a Hyatt. Excellent location. Close to transportation. Downtown location a plus. The Indian resturant is good and the bar has cold beer. I was here two nights and plan to stay at the Stillwell in Feb. 2006. Very close to Union Station if you travel Amtrak.

Reviews.Title: “Run away!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I saw the pictures on the internet and when I got there, it was disappointing. The hotel is really old, dirty and smells badly (like rotten food). My first thought was moving to another hotel, but I decided to give it a chance and asked the lady in the reception to show me a bedroom. In a rude way, she said she couldn't because they had no empty room at that time (really hard to believe!) and I would have to wait 3 hours to check in. Moreover, I saw two scary men in the lobby, that seemed to be drunk and looked like beggars... I decided to go to another place, but still had to pay the one night price! Definitely, not recomended for girls traveling by themselves!

Reviews.Title: “Functional & Handy but not great”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Lonely Planet rates this place at the top of the list. The reviews here are at best mixed so i was unsure about this place. I found that the room and the washroom was clean and adequate for my purposes. I got some noise from the street (i was on the 8th floor) but that didn't really bother me. This was my first time in LA and i had heard about how unsafe downtown is. A reviewers comments on how unsafe it was did not help. I was pleasantly surprised to find that downtown was not half as unsafe as i thought it would be. I felt that there were perhaps only a few more homeless people proportionally than i would find here in Toronto, Canada. I also walked around at odd hours of day and night and although downtown is deserted after dark, i did not find it unsafe. I found that the staff were not overly friendly but they were quite functional as in they called me when the tour van arrived, called cabs for me and kept my valuables and luggage (at no cost). So i cannot complain about that. The comment about the Indian restaurant is perhaps somewhat valid. I love the odd curry but the whole lobby smelled like the restaurant. Although once inside the elevator, it was fine. The hotel is defintely handy. I was in LA for 5 days and did not need to rent a car. I walked to the places downtown (Library, LA Symphone orchestra building, Modern Art gallery - all excellent), took the Metro on a couple of occasions (under 10 min walk from the hotel) and cabbed a couple of times. A subway is not too far away, and a department store is 10 min walk as well. So it is difficult to complain about the location. What i do not know, i found difficult to find and would be useful to know is that for a similar price (US$ 55) what are the other places in the vicinity and how do those places compare. That information would be useful to have and will be appreciated. I hope this review helps.

Reviews.Title: “Scary place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was deceived by the pictures and description on a website. I got in late at night and found the place rundown and a bit frightening. My room had very old furniture (TV turn dial) and the room seemed less than clean. The only lock on the door was the doorknob push button. The shower head was broken in the tub. I checked out early and moved to another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I was disappointed.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I spent a weekend in LA for a wedding a stayed at the Stillwell. I was disappointed. The price was great, but that was it. The room was small and the bathroom was even smaller with the towel rack ready to fall down. The TV barely worked and the towels were so old and thin that you could see through them. There was an element in the lobby that made it feel like a residential hotel for the down and out. I would not recommend staying there, unless you have no other choice.

HotelInfo.Name: Stillwell Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 838 South Grand Avenue, Los Angeles, CA 90017
